alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Abbeville and Greenwood Counties in the South Carolina Upstate. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain and thunderstorms lingering with several locales receiving around 1.5 inches of rain so far today. Periods of heavy rain and storms will continue to develop across the advised area this afternoon with totals nearing 3 inches in spots. Flooding of low-lying areas throughout greater Greenwood and Abbeville is expected to develop, with river and stream rises thoughout the Long Cane, Little River, Ninety-Six and Coronaca Creek basins. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenwood, Abbeville, Ninety Six, Cokesbury, Troy, Ninety Six Historic Site, Lake Greenwood, Greenwood State Park, Promised Land, Bradley, Coronaca, Epworth, Callison, Kirksey and Dyson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
